businessProfile.name: Union Pier Social
businessProfile.address: 16036 Red Arrow Hwy, Union Pier, MI 49129, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 16036 Red Arrow Hwy, Union Pier, MI 49129, USA

reviews.text: Went on a Monday after a day at the beach.  No wait for a table, unlike some of our other experiences in the area.  Our server, Amy, was very friendly and helpful with questions. Cheese curds for an appetizer turned out to be a good start, everybody enjoyed them.  Lots of good drink choices, with some Michigan beers available.  Ribs were delicious, good smokey flavor and cooked perfect.  Burger and mac and cheese were great. Wish I could have talked my daughter into adding the brisket with the mac and cheese, but she wasn't interested.  No room for dessert.  Would return if in the area again.

We stopped in for an early dinner on a Wednesday. It was very slow and we basically had the place to ourselves. The staff went above and beyond to make our first time amazing. My husband ordered the All-American burger and fries which he enjoyed throughly. I ordered a Ranch Water to drink and the Fish & Chips. Let me tell you, their fries are phenomenal! The fish not so much. BUT, as I said, the staff was extremely friendly and involved to try to fix the issue. The first batch that came out, the batter was quite dark and yet there was no crisp or crunch and was almost raw in spots. The fish inside was still fresh, delicious, and cooked perfectly and their tartar sauce was delicious! Our server brought it to the attention of the manager and chef. They made me another batch to try again on the batter. Even though it didn't work the second time, I wasn't upset. They handled the situation amazingly and even brought out a small to-go of their Chocolate Cake to apologize. We still left full, happy, and wanting to go back again in the future. Hopefully the 4 stars can go up to a 5. Thank you again for the great food and hospitality!

Cute place with a great atmosphere and outdoor seating!
We stopped by Union Pier Social and loved everything about it. The outdoor seating was perfect for a sunny day, and the food was just as impressive. The pizza was loaded with flavor ‚Äî melty cheese, sweet pineapple, savory BBQ, and a kick of freshness from the scallions. The salad was colorful and packed with texture ‚Äî crunchy tortilla strips, roasted corn, buffalo cauliflower, and creamy dressing on the side. Definitely a spot we‚Äôll come back to!

Great food at reasonable prices. The servers were very friendly and attentive, and drinks were delicious!! Can't ask for much more than that! So happy we stopped here (twice) on our vacation and looking forward to coming back :)

Cheese curds? Handmade. Martini? They added glitter. My salad? Phenomenal as always.
And the patio? Dog friendly, shady and the interior is beautiful!
Absolutely recommend this spot!

recentReviews.text: What a fun, vibrant bar/restaurant! The staff is incredible- especially Steven (manager?). He was energetic, knowledgeable, super attentive and ensured we thoroughly enjoyed our food (we did!). We will definitely back - the music was also on point.

Delicious! Super cute place inside and out. Outdoor patio is a vibe. Food was SO GOOD! We went for my birthday and had a wonderful time! Order the chicken jerk pizza - or the brisket sandwich! You won‚Äôt go wrong! üòã

I am a local and usually our winters are much quieter than the other seasons with the exception of this past winter where Steven the manager and his team launched an exciting series of events including Bingo, Trivia to name a couple. There was an evening where the line was out the door for Bingo. The menu and chef are incredible and we love the home away from home staff like Trisha and Rachel!! If you ever get a chance stop in as you are in for a treat and if you can catch Steven that is even better as he is work horse constantly moving and making everyone feel special.

Love, love, love this place. Food is great, and service is even better. The manager Steven is always so nice and hard working. Always making sure EVERYONE feels welcome here! Trisha and Rachel are also amazing!

We came into Union Pier social while in town for the weekend having never heard of the place. We had an amazing brunch made all the more enjoyable by our amazing server Steve! He was a blast and his food recos were A+. Will definitely be back!

Had a lovely meal at Union Pier Social on Sunday afternoon.  They were crazy busy but the staff was hustling!  Our food was great, really enjoyed the beer selection and our server was very knowledgeable about the area and the business.  We were sat next to a table that was not very nice to our server Steven.  They were talking about the recent assassination and politics (in a negative manner) and he was pretty nice when he told them that what they were discussing wasn't appropriate and asked them to switch topics.  This couple wouldn't stop pushing it.  They were riding that server hard.  But everytime he came back to our table he had smiles and jokes.  We will be back next time we are in the area!  Keep up the good work guys, don't let haters bring you down!

We gave Union Pier Social a try for the first time, and it was a mistake. The place was disorganized and mismanaged from the moment we walked in. After waiting just to be noticed, we were seated among dirty tables that hadn‚Äôt been cleared.

Our server, Steve, was abrupt, snooty, and inattentive‚Äîmore interested in attitude than service. The food? Mediocre at best, and certainly not worth overlooking the lack of hospitality.

This was a disappointing experience all around. We won‚Äôt be back, and we won‚Äôt be recommending Union Pier Social to anyone.

Excellent food and service!  Cheese curd deck Buffalo style highly recommended and the jerk pizza was great‚Äîthe crust is the best part!  Outdoor seating on a beautiful day made for even better experience.  Will return!

detailedReviews.author: Andrea Opperman
detailedReviews.text: What a fun, vibrant bar/restaurant! The staff is incredible- especially Steven (manager?). He was energetic, knowledgeable, super attentive and ensured we thoroughly enjoyed our food (we did!). We will definitely back - the music was also on point.

detailedReviews.author: Kristal Melendez
detailedReviews.text: Delicious! Super cute place inside and out. Outdoor patio is a vibe. Food was SO GOOD! We went for my birthday and had a wonderful time! Order the chicken jerk pizza - or the brisket sandwich! You won‚Äôt go wrong! üòã

detailedReviews.author: Billie Akauola
detailedReviews.text: I am a local and usually our winters are much quieter than the other seasons with the exception of this past winter where Steven the manager and his team launched an exciting series of events including Bingo, Trivia to name a couple. There was an evening where the line was out the door for Bingo. The menu and chef are incredible and we love the home away from home staff like Trisha and Rachel!! If you ever get a chance stop in as you are in for a treat and if you can catch Steven that is even better as he is work horse constantly moving and making everyone feel special.

detailedReviews.author: Corrigan Karsten
detailedReviews.text: Love, love, love this place. Food is great, and service is even better. The manager Steven is always so nice and hard working. Always making sure EVERYONE feels welcome here! Trisha and Rachel are also amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Katie and Maja Bero
detailedReviews.text: We came into Union Pier social while in town for the weekend having never heard of the place. We had an amazing brunch made all the more enjoyable by our amazing server Steve! He was a blast and his food recos were A+. Will definitely be back!

Our food was great, really enjoyed the beer selection and our server was very knowledgeable about the area and the business.  We were sat next to a table that was not very nice to our server Steven. Keep up the good work guys, don't let haters bring you down!

detailedReviews.author: John Everett
detailedReviews.text:
We gave Union Pier Social a try for the first time, and it was a mistake. The place was disorganized and mismanaged from the moment we walked in. After waiting just to be noticed, we were seated among dirty tables that hadn‚Äôt been cleared.

Our server, Steve, was abrupt, snooty, and inattentive‚Äîmore interested in attitude than service. The food? Mediocre at best, and certainly not worth overlooking the lack of hospitality.

This was a disappointing experience all around. We won‚Äôt be back, and we won‚Äôt be recommending Union Pier Social to anyone.

detailedReviews.author: Kelly Vlasvich
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food and service!  Cheese curd deck Buffalo style highly recommended and the jerk pizza was great‚Äîthe crust is the best part!  Outdoor seating on a beautiful day made for even better experience.  Will return!

detailedReviews.author: David Emma
detailedReviews.text: Love this place.

detailedReviews.author: Connell O'Brien
detailedReviews.text: Food, service and atmosphere - all was great!

detailedReviews.author: Jeremy Peterson
detailedReviews.text: Great place to bring some friends,family or a nice date night.

detailedReviews.author: Gina Nicholos
detailedReviews.text: Overall, great place to eat and go out with people! It has a very fun yet relaxing vibe, live music, and a good layout. The menu has several options for different people, and enough options that it was somewhat difficult to pick. The food tasted very good and came out hot. Unfortunately, the service was pretty subpar. In total, we were at the restaurant for a little over two hours. The wait time was understandable because of how many people were there, but we rarely saw our server and had to constantly try to get her attention for refills and the bill. Would likely go back and give it another chance for service because the atmosphere and food are great.

detailedReviews.author: Leanne Alvizu
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in quick on our way.  Food was great. Trisha is awesome.

detailedReviews.author: Suomirakastaa
detailedReviews.text: We stopped in for an early dinner on a Wednesday. It was very slow and we basically had the place to ourselves. The staff went above and beyond to make our first time amazing. My husband ordered the All-American burger and fries which he enjoyed throughly. I ordered a Ranch Water to drink and the Fish & Chips. Let me tell you, their fries are phenomenal! The fish not so much. BUT, as I said, the staff was extremely friendly and involved to try to fix the issue. The first batch that came out, the batter was quite dark and yet there was no crisp or crunch and was almost raw in spots. The fish inside was still fresh, delicious, and cooked perfectly and their tartar sauce was delicious! Our server brought it to the attention of the manager and chef. They made me another batch to try again on the batter. Even though it didn't work the second time, I wasn't upset. They handled the situation amazingly and even brought out a small to-go of their Chocolate Cake to apologize. We still left full, happy, and wanting to go back again in the future. Hopefully the 4 stars can go up to a 5. Thank you again for the great food and hospitality!

detailedReviews.author: Jessica Anderson
detailedReviews.text: Went for mother's Day. It was really good food. Definitely a buffet setting. But if you're looking to sit around the table, enjoy some time with your family. This is ultimately the place I would pick.

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth
detailedReviews.text: Our server Amy was fantastic! Great service. Try the homemade soups!

detailedReviews.author: E V 1
detailedReviews.text: Nice outdoor dining area and many tables indoors.  Service was attentive and food was great.

detailedReviews.author: Jackie G
detailedReviews.text: Was very busy, so service was slower than we would have liked, we were just short on timeüòâ

detailedReviews.author: Narda Black
detailedReviews.text: Fun stop with delicious food and friendly staff! Yappy hour was a blast, even without a dog üêï

detailedReviews.author: Daryl Phillips
detailedReviews.text: Good carry out meal but didn‚Äôt they want to cater to a large group of 10 on a busy Saturday night. Still accommodated us and let us order and food was ready on time. Maybe the best take away fries I‚Äôve had since Covid.

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer Fleming
detailedReviews.text: Pretty nice place with minimal wait!

detailedReviews.author: Sarah Schroeder
detailedReviews.text:
Cheese curds? Handmade. Martini? They added glitter. My salad? Phenomenal as always.
And the patio? Dog friendly, shady and the interior is beautiful!
Absolutely recommend this spot!

detailedReviews.author: Heather Emke
detailedReviews.text: Leah and Alana were phenomenal and incredibly charismatic servers! The food was delicious, and the drinks were tasty. I can‚Äôt wait to come back! The only feedback I‚Äôd give is to offer a wider selection of tequila options. :)

detailedReviews.author: Doni Tschopp
detailedReviews.text:
If you want amazing service ask for Amy.
Food was great and she is very good at recommending items, we have never been here before and Amy has the amazing ability to recommend food choices.
We will definitely be back

detailedReviews.author: j53wigg
detailedReviews.text: Well!!, you know ,when it smells like some good smokin meat outside the restaurant and the photo on the menu looks üòã you anticipate the food to look like whats on the menu, but hey !!!! The waitress was nice ,and  exchanged  my order in a timely manner.... would i go back you say?, ü§î NAWWWWW

detailedReviews.author: Rick Ruth
detailedReviews.text: Best burgers around and the truffle fries are outstanding!

detailedReviews.author: Jeanne Weckler
detailedReviews.text: Lots of vegetarian options! Pretty pricey, but good quality and good-sized portions

detailedReviews.author: Tina Presi
detailedReviews.text: Extremely good

detailedReviews.author: Marty Joseph
detailedReviews.text: We are back to Union Pier each weekend and enjoy dinner at least one evening and it is always fantastic. Food, beer selection, servers and bartenders, and atmosphere is always great!!!üòÄ

detailedReviews.author: Debra Standerski
detailedReviews.text: I had the Falafel Entree.  It was fantastic.  Great service.  Everyone very friendly.

detailedReviews.author: Pamela DiCarlantonio
detailedReviews.text: Three of us had lunch here today. The service was great but the food was hit-or-miss. We split the ahi tuna tacos as an appetizer and they were very good (if not light on the amount of tuna in each). My adult son ordered the Italian beef sandwich but didn‚Äôt love it (although the fries were excellent). Now to the Marguerita pizza . . . which was very disappointing. The crust was paper thin and soggy on the bottom but huge and puffy around the edges, and both were extremely bland and flavorless. If you‚Äôre in the mood for pizza, you‚Äôll find better options around town. This was our first visit and we will likely try again at some point - but we‚Äôll steer clear of the pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Whitney Redman
detailedReviews.text:
Cute place with a great atmosphere and outdoor seating!
We stopped by Union Pier Social and loved everything about it. The outdoor seating was perfect for a sunny day, and the food was just as impressive. The pizza was loaded with flavor ‚Äî melty cheese, sweet pineapple, savory BBQ, and a kick of freshness from the scallions. The salad was colorful and packed with texture ‚Äî crunchy tortilla strips, roasted corn, buffalo cauliflower, and creamy dressing on the side. Definitely a spot we‚Äôll come back to!

detailedReviews.author: Shaun C
detailedReviews.text: Leaving this review specifically to recognize Amy V. who was our server last night.  She provided some of the friendliest service we've had in ages anywhere.  She floated through dinner service singing along with the music, but somehow always knowing when we needed a refill or plates cleared.  We had a very great night!

detailedReviews.author: Tobey Sanford
detailedReviews.text: Union Pier Social was incredible for our 24 person party! To celebrate a family 70th birthday, we called ahead and they reserved for us their side room with a decorative divider from the main space. All of the employees were very nice, and our server, Sam, was pleasant and on top of it! Their menu has a wonderful variety of options for adults and kids.  We were all shocked at how quickly they brought out our orders, and everyone talked about how much they liked the food. The bar and patio looked very nice. We look forward to coming again. Highly recommended.

detailedReviews.author: Ron Folkens
detailedReviews.text: Went on a Monday after a day at the beach.  No wait for a table, unlike some of our other experiences in the area.  Our server, Amy, was very friendly and helpful with questions. Cheese curds for an appetizer turned out to be a good start, everybody enjoyed them.  Lots of good drink choices, with some Michigan beers available.  Ribs were delicious, good smokey flavor and cooked perfect.  Burger and mac and cheese were great. Wish I could have talked my daughter into adding the brisket with the mac and cheese, but she wasn't interested.  No room for dessert.  Would return if in the area again.

detailedReviews.author: Melissa Louise
detailedReviews.text: We loved sitting outside with a drink & an app!

detailedReviews.author: Paul Lukowski
detailedReviews.text: Food just average, as was the service.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Lindstrom (Mikeal)
detailedReviews.text: Great food and dog friendly!

detailedReviews.author: Phyllis Herczeg
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in for Sunday dinner and enjoyed the relaxed beachy vibe. Members of our crew enjoyed a great meat lovers pizza and the Italian beef got an A+. Good service and good food! The vino slushy hit the spot!

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Brand
detailedReviews.text: LOVE union pier social! we eat here weekly & will continue. laid back atmosphere ava friendly vibes. you must try!

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Fox
detailedReviews.text: This is our second time coming to Union Pier. The first time it was so good we decided to come back and meet with the Manager Steven, to talk about booking a future catering event. He was so accommodating. His customer service is impeccable. He listened to our needs. He showed so much kindness, when asked to work with a family member‚Äôs allergies. He is most certainly  an asset to Union Pier Social. I discovered they do different charities and give back to the local community. I love that! I look forward to working with Steven and Union Pier Social. Thank you. This visit we had the summer berry salad and the strawberry bruschetta. Oh, and they make their own bread.

detailedReviews.author: Socorro Bredeweg
detailedReviews.text: We had a great experience at Union Pier. Amy was our server. What an outstanding amazing job she did, there was 20 of us and we all had individual checks which sorry about that Amy, but wow, I am in awe of everything, she did all our orders and the food was absolutely delicious.  God bless you all and take care of yourself . AMY You are doing a great job

detailedReviews.author: Michael Fraser
detailedReviews.text: I was there for a wedding reception. The service was a little slow at first but after that it was great. The place was almost full and they took care of everyone.

detailedReviews.author: Cynthia Ash
detailedReviews.text: This is definitely a new favorite. Cheese curds are delicious! Really enjoyed the brisket taco‚Äôs and pineapple slaw! Server was great And Steve the manager is the best!

detailedReviews.author: Rich Peterson
detailedReviews.text: I'm not sure where the ratings for this place came from.  The food is mediocre at best.  We visited at 6 pm on a Wednesday and they were out of the brisket and Italian beef sandwiches.  Kind of unacceptable when the menu isn't extensive to begin with and they weren't busy.  The pulled pork sandwich was meh and the Chick-aming sandwich was blah.  Service wasn't good either.  We had to flag down a different server to get flatware, napkins and drink refills after our food arrived as our server was nowhere to be found and he never checked in until we finished.  I guess it helps that there aren't many options in this area . . .  One visit was too many.  Not coming back.

detailedReviews.author: Chris T
detailedReviews.text: Attended the dueling pianos last week.  Cost was $15 pp, and we thought that much of this would go toward the entertainers.  The beginning of the piano entertainment was good, but degraded to the piano players working the audience for tips.  A pitcher of ice and some sangria was $45 + tax & tip.  We expected more, but the experience was underwhelming.

detailedReviews.author: Britney Llewellyn
detailedReviews.text: This place has great staff and food! I love the welcoming environment. They have a lot of vegetarian options.

detailedReviews.author: Fede Conde
detailedReviews.text:
Great Gem on the Red Arrow Hwy. nice ambiance, friendly service and fabulous brisket taco plate (made two meals for me).
Greatness check: the tortillas do not break into pieces when folded.

detailedReviews.author: Stephanie Manning
detailedReviews.text: Ordered the classic American cheeseburger. Was just okay, kind of dry. Didn't eat the fries that came with it because they were cold. Maybe they were having an off day based on other reviews? We were not very impressed.

detailedReviews.author: Fabio Sorano
detailedReviews.text: Spacious and nice interior. It was relatively fast to get seated for lunch on a Sunday in june. Our server was very friendly. We loved all the pride flags everywhere. We had the shroom burger with truffle fries and Southwest cobb salad. Both good choices and we will be back. It's nice not to have to drive into The madness of New Buffalo

detailedReviews.author: Medina Christopher
detailedReviews.text: Great place to go for good food.  Variety on the menu.

detailedReviews.author: Judy W
detailedReviews.text: Always a good time in tuesday!  was the big bingo tonight congrats to the winner   was a little to loud so could barely hear steve lol  good was great and our server alana was awesome  very attentive and did an awesome job !!

detailedReviews.author: Dario Manjarres
detailedReviews.text: El sitio es bastante agradable. La comida es muy buena. No es muy costoso, realmente accesible. Su anfitriona habla dos idiomas ingl√©s y espa√±ol. Es una chica muy amable. Demoraron un poco en asignarnos una mesa. Y no veo muy bien que los tenedores, cucharas y cuchillos est√©n en la entrada y los envuelven en la servilleta delante de los clientes y los lleven contigo al momento de asignarte le mesa. Pero de resto todo perfecto. Me encant√≥ el lugar, si volver√≠a. Y los fines de semana hay m√∫sica en vivo.

detailedReviews.author: Jim T
detailedReviews.text: This place was a recommendation from Gordon's Inn. Bar food and pizza. Burger was good, and frozen pizza crust was not eatable. Staff was great üëç!

detailedReviews.author: Terri
detailedReviews.text: Great food at reasonable prices. The servers were very friendly and attentive, and drinks were delicious!! Can't ask for much more than that! So happy we stopped here (twice) on our vacation and looking forward to coming back :)

detailedReviews.author: jacquline heth
detailedReviews.text: Everything is always fabulous here!!

detailedReviews.author: Amanda Green
detailedReviews.text:
Came for bingo one Tuesday evening. From the time I stepped into the time I left, I  experienced stupendous service!

Will and Trisha are amazing bartenders!

Avery was an awesome server!

Steven, one of the managers, was incredibly funny and welcoming

The deck of curds were out of this world, the garlic dough balls were awesome, and the truffle fries are a regular order for me as well

The pot roast was cooked to perfection, so moist and flavorful!

Every visit is just phenomenal :)

detailedReviews.author: Lorie Dillon
detailedReviews.text: People here were very friendly. The food was good and the live music was great. The patio looks awesome but we were there when it was a bit too cool to be outside. We'll definitely return!

detailedReviews.author: Alex Richer
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful

detailedReviews.author: Craig Akers
detailedReviews.text: Best service, food, Tricia is the best!

detailedReviews.author: Jessica Klemp
detailedReviews.text: Great place to grab a quick bite to eat! The staff was super friendly and the food was excellent. I would recommend stopping in!

detailedReviews.author: Patty Bonzani
detailedReviews.text: First time here for Mother's Day brunch. Food was hot & a nice variety. Service was excellent & Steven is amazing! He made sure everyone was taken care of & happy with their experience. I will definitely be back!

detailedReviews.author: Lisa Potter
detailedReviews.text: Love this place

detailedReviews.author: Suzy Stevens
detailedReviews.text: The food is of the best quality. Cheese curds, pizza & mac & cheese were all the best I've had!

detailedReviews.author: Shelly Taylor
detailedReviews.text: We LOVE Union Pier Social! It‚Äôs our go-to restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Leslie Cesario
detailedReviews.text: We LOVE Union Pier Social.  We usually do carry out. The staff is so considerate. Always asking if I need a water if I get there early to pick up our food. We LOVE the school burger. So tasty and so moist.

detailedReviews.author: Kyle Lawrence
detailedReviews.text: A great spot with amazing food and drinks. The service is top notch!

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Sloan
detailedReviews.text:
Sat in the bar area and had a delicious meal. Service was fast and friendly.

GET THE MEATBALL GRINDER!
If you like meatballs, marinara, and cheese on a perfectly toasted bun, you will LOVE this sandwich.

At the Manager's suggestion we got the cheese curds with a cup of caramel to dip in. The most amazing and unexpected desert I've ever had.

The atmosphere is really pleasant and the music is upbeat and fun, but not too loud.

detailedReviews.author: Leslie Cesario
detailedReviews.text: Staff is great..pleasant and helpful. Always smiling. We had Shroom burger which was so moist and tasty, Margherita pizza that tasted amazing and meatballs grinder which was out of this world. Great specials as well.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the vibrant atmosphere and live music, creating a fun and relaxing vibe that enhances the dining experience. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The staff, particularly manager Steven, is frequently commended for their exceptional service, attentiveness, and ability to make every guest feel welcome and special. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The menu offers a variety of delicious options, with specific dishes like the chicken jerk pizza and brisket sandwich receiving high praise. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and inattentive service - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness - social media marketing can improve this area

negative.author: John Everett
negative.text:
We gave Union Pier Social a try for the first time, and it was a mistake. The place was disorganized and mismanaged from the moment we walked in. After waiting just to be noticed, we were seated among dirty tables that hadn‚Äôt been cleared.

Our server, Steve, was abrupt, snooty, and inattentive‚Äîmore interested in attitude than service. The food? Mediocre at best, and certainly not worth overlooking the lack of hospitality.

This was a disappointing experience all around. We won‚Äôt be back, and we won‚Äôt be recommending Union Pier Social to anyone.
